intro: Alpinia neragaimae, commonly known as the Kumaon ginger, is a species of flowering plant native to the Himalayan region of India. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes other economically important plants like ginger and turmeric. The plant is characterized by its tall, rhizomatous growth and clusters of fragrant, pinkish-white flowers. Its leaves are broad and glossy, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical studies.
